title: Multi-robot Multi-source Localization in Complex Flows with Physics-Preserving Environment Models
summary: This paper addresses multi-robot multi-source localization in complex, time-varying flows, where sensor readings are sporadic and intermittent. It focuses on accurately accounting for physical processes driving dispersion dynamics using physics-preserving environment models.
usefulness_reason: Score 85 assigned because the paper deals with "multi-source localization in complex flows" with "time-varying and chaotic" dynamics and "sporadic and intermittent sensor readings". This strongly aligns with "Spatio Temporal" and the nature of the sensor readings suggests a "Point Process" interpretation of events in space and time.
